info.title: Exercise Action API
info.description: The act of participating in exertive activity for the purposes of improving health and fitness.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search for item

parameters.name: actionstatus
parameters.description: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

parameters.name: additionaltype
parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the \'typeof\' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

parameters.name: agent
parameters.description: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

parameters.name: alternatename
parameters.description: An alias for the item.

parameters.name: audience
parameters.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created. Supersedes serviceAudience.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the item.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

parameters.name: endtime
parameters.description: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*.Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action. Supersedes events.

parameters.name: exercisecourse
parameters.description: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken. Supersedes course.

parameters.name: exerciseplan
parameters.description: A sub property of instrument. The exercise plan used on this action.

parameters.name: exerciserelateddiet
parameters.description: A sub property of instrument. The diet used in this action. Supersedes diet.

parameters.name: exercisetype
parameters.description: Type(s) of exercise or activity, such as strength training, flexibility training, aerobics, cardiac rehabilitation, etc.

parameters.name: fromlocation
parameters.description: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

parameters.name: instrument
parameters.description: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

parameters.name: mainentityofpage
parameters.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the item.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object upon the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn\'t). e.g. John read *a book*.

parameters.name: opponent
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.

parameters.name: participant
parameters.description: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

parameters.name: potentialaction
parameters.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an \'object\' role.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote *a book*.

parameters.name: sameas
parameters.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item\'s identity. E.g. the URL of the item\'s Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

parameters.name: sportsactivitylocation
parameters.description: A sub property of location. The sports activity location where this action occurred.

parameters.name: sportsevent
parameters.description: A sub property of location. The sports event where this action occurred.

parameters.name: sportsteam
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The sports team that participated on this action.

parameters.name: starttime
parameters.description: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December.Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.

parameters.name: tolocation
parameters.description: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.description: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.
